content: Do dogs sweat through their mouths by salivating to cool down?

Yes, dogs do sweat, but not in the same way humans do. Dogs have sweat glands, but they are mostly located in their paw pads. So, when dogs get hot, they pant to cool down instead of sweating like humans do. The saliva in their mouth helps to evaporate heat, which cools them down. So, in a way, you could say they sweat through their mouths by salivating to cool down.
